 document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function () {
    (function () {
      function checkAndStoreInternalSource() {
        // Get the current URL
        const url = new URL(window.location.href);

        // Check if the internal_source parameter exists
        const internalSource = url.searchParams.get('internal_source');

        if (internalSource) {

      function getSlug() {
        const urlPath = window.location.pathname;
        const slug = urlPath.substring(urlPath.lastIndexOf('/') + 1);
        if (slug === '') {
          return 'main_page';
        }
        return slug;
      }

      // Function to determine the interaction type based on the URL
      function getInteractionType() {
        const urlPath = window.location.pathname;
        if (urlPath === '/') {
          return 'main_page';
        } else if (urlPath.includes('/blog/')) {
          return 'blog_article';

          return 'vision';

        } else if (urlPath.includes('/customers/')) {

          return 'get_demo';

          urlPath.includes('/integrations') ||

		  urlPath.includes('/employee-onboarding')
        ) {
          return 'lp';
        }
        return 'Unknown';
      }
      
      const definedInteractionType = getInteractionType();
      // Function to save data to local storage if not already set
      function saveFirstInteractionData() {
        const slug = getSlug();
        if (slug !== 'demo') {
          localStorage.setItem('prev_page_slug', slug);
        }
        if (!localStorage.getItem('firstInteractionDate')) {
          const firstInteractionDate = new Date().toISOString();
          const interactionType = definedInteractionType;

          localStorage.setItem('firstInteractionDate', firstInteractionDate);
          localStorage.setItem('interactionType', interactionType);
          if (interactionType === 'blog_article') {
            localStorage.setItem('article_slug', slug);
          } else if (interactionType === 'definition') {
            localStorage.setItem('definition_slug', slug);
          } else if (interactionType === 'solutions_lp') {
            localStorage.setItem('lp_slug', slug);
          } else if (interactionType === 'lp') {
            localStorage.setItem('lp_slug', slug);
          }
        }
      }

      // Save the first interaction data
      saveFirstInteractionData();
      // Function to add UTM parameters to sign-up links
      function addUTMParameters() {
        const firstInteractionDate = localStorage.getItem('firstInteractionDate');
        const interactionType = localStorage.getItem('interactionType');
        const articleSlug = localStorage.getItem('article_slug');
        const definitionSlug = localStorage.getItem('definition_slug');
        const lpSlug = localStorage.getItem('lp_slug');
        const currentPageSlug = getSlug();
        const internalSource = localStorage.getItem('internal_source');

        document.querySelectorAll('a[href*="app.educate-me.co/signUp"]').forEach(function (link) {

      }

      // Add UTM parameters to sign-up links on page load
      addUTMParameters();

Top Trends in Corporate Training for 2025
Lifelong Learning
There are no longer professions for life, and education alone is not enough today for a specialist to be able to do the job effectively and for the company not to stop in its development.
[Recent research](https://www.chieflearningofficer.com/2023/10/06/closing-the-skills-gap-is-a-modern-fairytale/) shows that skills have a half-life. Its duration depends on the sphere. For example, the half-life of specialized technology skills is less than 2.5 years.
💡 Interesting Note: The most “long-lived” are soft skills that are fundamental in nature: design thinking, effective communication, leadership, and the ability to work in a team.
Therefore, continuing education is clearly an important trend in the [corporate training](/blog/corporate-training) sector.
Personalized Learning
Adaptive or personalized learning is a popular topic at all specialized conferences. In essence, this is a method that focuses on the employee’s personality and allows you to create an educational track based on existing knowledge, skills, and needs.
Personalization of training helps to unlock potential and get the most out of education: the employee does not waste time on “general” programs that do not take into account their needs for new skills.
💡 Interesting Note: It is significant to understand that it requires a greater variety of educational content, constant updating, and tools for assessing knowledge & analyzing progress.
Soft Skills Development
Soft skills determine an employee’s professional success by 85%, while hard skills determine only 15%, according to [research from Harvard University](https://www.nationalsoftskills.org/the-soft-skills-disconnect/).
Most companies are still focused only on developing the professional qualities of employees, and their mastery of programs, tools, and technologies to improve their competence. But today, without developed soft skills, it is impossible to be truly effective. If you do not develop the “soft” skills of your team, the manager will have to regularly spend time on additional control and resolution of internal conflicts.
💡 Interesting Note: The top 5 soft skills that are important to develop in employees include communication, self-management, teamwork, critical thinking and proactivity.
Reskilling
Reskilling is teaching new skills to an employee for their transition to new positions, implementation in another profession, or adaptation to significant changes in current positions.
Reskilling helps companies:
- solve the problem of personnel shortage;
- retain and motivate employees;
- expand opportunities to fill current vacancies.
💡 Interesting Note: One of the top 3 reasons why employees quit is the lack of opportunities for career growth that are not provided by the employer, according to a[Pew Research Center]survey.
